data.headline: January CPI rose 0.2% month-over-month and 2.4% year-over-year, both below forecasts, reinforcing the disinflation trend.
bullets: Core inflation hit near four-year lows around 2.5%, driven by cheaper gasoline, broader energy, used cars, and moderating rents.
Lower inflation data increased odds of Fed rate cuts and pushed Treasury yields down.
Russell 2000 outperformed with a gain of about 1.5%, leading a rotation into small caps and value stocks.
Tariff-exposed metals and steel stocks lagged the broader market.
S&P 500 (+0.3%), Dow (+0.2%), and Nasdaq (+0.1%â€“0.3%) posted modest gains but remain on track for weekly losses.
AI-driven tech sector pressures persisted, with few major catalysts beyond inflation data aside from select earnings winners like Applied Materials.
